Coords

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • Coords.Map

  • public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    Description: the class represents a picture of a map and its fields are an image, gps points of top left and bottom right corners of the image and the bounds of the image. the class also turns gps coordinates into x,y pixels, and back, and calculates the 2d distance between two points.
    Author:
    Yarden and Caroline

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Map()
      Description: the constructor uses its default coordinates for topleft and bottomright.
      Map(java.lang.String pathName, LatLonAlt top_left, LatLonAlt bottom_right, double distx, double disty)
      Description: the constructor receives a file name for the image and the top left and bottom right gps coordinates for the image's corners.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      LatLonAlt AdvanceDistance(LatLonAlt gps0, LatLonAlt gps1, double distance)
      Description: the method calculate the coordinate between source(gps0) and destination(gps1) where the source advances a given distance in meters.
      Point3D CoordsToPixels(LatLonAlt coord)
      Description: the method receives a gps point and returns it as x,y values of the given image.
      java.awt.Image getImage() 
      java.lang.Object gps2Pixel(GAMEcoords pacmansGPS) 
      double PixelDistance(Point3D pxl1, Point3D pxl2)
      Description: the method calculates the distance between two given pixels.
      LatLonAlt PixelsToCoords(LatLonAlt location) 
      LatLonAlt PixelsToCoords(Point3D pxl)
      Description: the method receives a pixel(x,y) and turns it into gps.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        public Map(java.lang.String pathName,
           LatLonAlt top_left,
           LatLonAlt bottom_right,
           double distx,
           double disty)
        Description: the constructor receives a file name for the image and the top left and bottom right gps coordinates for the image's corners. the constructor treats the top left corner as the (0,0) and by using the method "vector3D" from MyCoords class we are given the x,y values in meters and thus the bounds of the image.
        Parameters:
        pathName -
        top_left -
        bottom_right -

      • Map

        public Map()
        Description: the constructor uses its default coordinates for topleft and bottomright.
        Parameters:
        pathName -

    • Method Detail

      • CoordsToPixels

        public Point3D CoordsToPixels(LatLonAlt coord)
        Description: the method receives a gps point and returns it as x,y values of the given image. altitude will remain 0.
        Parameters:
        coord -

      • PixelsToCoords

        public LatLonAlt PixelsToCoords(Point3D pxl)
        Description: the method receives a pixel(x,y) and turns it into gps. altitude will remain 0.
        Parameters:
        pxl -

      • PixelDistance

        public double PixelDistance(Point3D pxl1,
                            Point3D pxl2)
        Description: the method calculates the distance between two given pixels.
        Parameters:
        pxl1 -
        pxl2 -

      • AdvanceDistance

        public LatLonAlt AdvanceDistance(LatLonAlt gps0,
                                 LatLonAlt gps1,
                                 double distance)
        Description: the method calculate the coordinate between source(gps0) and destination(gps1) where the source advances a given distance in meters. the method uses Haversine formula to find the distance between source to destination, and uses it to find the ratio to alter the source. see also: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3073281/how-to-move-a-marker-100-meters-with-coordinates
        Parameters:
        gps0 -
        gps1 -
        distance -
        Returns:
        new coordinate
